con.para: Energy is the ability to do work! It makes things move, light up, and power machines.
Gravity pulls everything toward the center of the Earth, so we don’t float away into space!
Gravity also keeps the Moon in orbit around the Earth and the planets around the Sun. That’s why we have day and night and why the planets don’t fly away!
When you drop something, gravity pulls it down. The heavier it is, the more it is pulled down!
Mass is how much stuff an object has. Weight is how much gravity pulls on that mass. That’s why you weigh less on the Moon but your mass stays the same!
In free fall, only gravity pulls an object down. But in real life, air pushes against falling objects, slowing them down. This is called air resistance.
The speed of a falling object increases as it falls because gravity pulls it down faster and faster!
In space, astronauts experience something called "zero gravity." It’s not that there’s no gravity—it’s just that they’re falling around Earth, so they feel weightless!
Gravity affects everything, from the oceans (creating tides) to the shape of the Earth! Can you find other places where gravity is at work?
